title: Awais Leghari orders uninterrupted power supply during Muharram
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jun 22 (APP): Federal Minister for Power Division Sardar Awais Ahmad Khan Leghari has directed all distribution companies (DISCOs) across the country to take urgent and comprehensive measures to ensure uninterrupted power supply during Muharram ul Haram.
In a letter addressed to the chairmen and chief executive officers of all DISCOs, the minister emphasized the critical importance of providing seamless power supply during Muharram, particularly as millions of citizens are expected to participate in congregations and processions nationwide.
Highlighting the potential for extreme weather conditions, including heatwaves, Leghari stressed that citizens must be protected from any form of discomfort or disruption during the observance of religious ceremonies.
He ordered immediate repair and replacement of all damaged or malfunctioning electrical equipment in areas of DISCOs. Formation of emergency response teams in each DISCO, which have to be placed on high alert on Youm-e-Ashur.
He said that constant coordination with district administrations, law enforcement agencies, and religious organizations to ensure smooth operations.
He directed advance intimation to imambargahs, mosques, and key users regarding any scheduled maintenance or potential load management plans.
The minister further ordered that installation of standby power systems, including generators and UPS units, at all sensitive and high-priority locations should be ensured.
Deployment of 24/7 technical and operational staff, with the establishment of dedicated control centers at all operational levels must be ensured, he added.
Minister Leghari categorically stated that no negligence will be tolerated, and directed all companies to send an action-taken report regarding Muharram preparations to the Power Division without delay.
